com.google.code.objectprops
Class ObjectPropertiesStore

java.lang.Object
  com.google.code.objectprops.ObjectPropertiesStore

public class ObjectPropertiesStore
extends java.lang.Object

The ObjectPropertiesStore can serialize (and deserialize) the state of any Java object into a Properties object by serializing all (non-static and non-transient) fields.

Author:
Michael Karneim

Constructor Summary
ObjectPropertiesStore()
          Creates a new ObjectPropertiesStore.
ObjectPropertiesStore(java.util.Properties properties)
          Creates a new ObjectPropertiesStore with the given Properties object as database.
ObjectPropertiesStore(java.util.Properties properties, Formatter formatter)
          Create a new ObjectPropertiesStore with the given Properties object as database and the given Formatter.

          Clears the database.
 void clear(java.lang.String location)
          Clears all entries at the given location from the database.
 boolean containsObjectAt(java.lang.String location)
          Returns true, if the database contains any object at the specified location.

          Creates the default formatter.

          Returns the database.

          Creates and returns a new Java object of the given type populated with the values from the database.
 java.lang.Object readObject(java.lang.String location, java.lang.Class type)
          Creates and returns a new Java object of the given type populated with the values found at the given location inside the database.
 void writeObject(java.lang.Object obj)
          Writes the state of the given Java object into the database.
